trans-unit.source: Get Started with Mobile Services for Windows Store JavaScript apps | Azure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Mobile Services for Windows Store JavaScript apps | Azure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Windows Store development in JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Windows Store development in JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.INCLUDE [mobile-services-selector-get-started](../../includes/mobile-services-selector-get-started.md)]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.INCLUDE [mobile-services-selector-get-started](../../includes/mobile-services-selector-get-started.md)]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Windows Store JavaScript app using Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Windows Store JavaScript app using Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple *To do list* app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple *To do list* app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: The mobile service that you will create uses JavaScript for server-side business logic.
trans-unit.target: The mobile service that you will create uses JavaScript for server-side business logic.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fmobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-javascript-get-started%2F).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fmobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-javascript-get-started%2F).

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio 2013 Express for Windows]
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio 2013 Express for Windows]

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service

trans-unit.source: Create a new Windows Store app
trans-unit.target: Create a new Windows Store app

trans-unit.source: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Azure classic portal to create a new Windows Store 8.1 JavaScript app that connects to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Azure classic portal to create a new Windows Store 8.1 JavaScript app that connects to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure classic portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure classic portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the quickstart tab, click **Windows** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Windows Store app**.
trans-unit.target: In the quickstart tab, click **Windows** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Windows Store app**.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, download and install [Visual Studio 2013][Visual Studio 2013 Express for Windows] on your local computer or virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, download and install [Visual Studio 2013][Visual Studio 2013 Express for Windows] on your local computer or virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create TodoItem table** to create a table to store app data.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create TodoItem table** to create a table to store app data.

trans-unit.source: Under **Download and run your app**, select a language for your app, then click **Download**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Download and run your app**, select a language for your app, then click **Download**.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the project for the sample *To do list* application that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the project for the sample *To do list* application that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.

trans-unit.source: Run your Windows app
trans-unit.target: Run your Windows app

trans-unit.source: The final stage of this tutorial is to build and run your new app.
trans-unit.target: The final stage of this tutorial is to build and run your new app.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the location where you saved the compressed project files, expand the files on your computer, and open the solution file in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the location where you saved the compressed project files, expand the files on your computer, and open the solution file in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Press the **F5** key to rebuild the project and start the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the **F5** key to rebuild the project and start the app.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as *Complete the tutorial*, in **Insert a TodoItem**, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as *Complete the tutorial*, in **Insert a TodoItem**, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the second column in the app.
trans-unit.target: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the second column in the app.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Run the app again, and notice that data saved from the previous step is loaded from the mobile service after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Run the app again, and notice that data saved from the previous step is loaded from the mobile service after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: Back in the [Azure classic portal], click the **Data** tab and then click the **TodoItems** table.
trans-unit.target: Back in the [Azure classic portal], click the **Data** tab and then click the **TodoItems** table.

trans-unit.source: This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.
trans-unit.target: This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the default.js file.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the default.js file.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to work with the [Mobile Services client for HTML/JavaScript](mobile-services-html-how-to-use-client-library.md).
trans-unit.target: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to work with the [Mobile Services client for HTML/JavaScript](mobile-services-html-how-to-use-client-library.md).
